result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Gronitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: paid in full from bond posted
Continue with any AODA and recommendations

Supervision fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

timeConds.notes:
No conditional jail 
**AMENDED 1/7/2016 to reflect jail credit**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in custody from Kononia - in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 15cm300,15cm253,15cm151,15cm422,14cm428,15cm379,145TR993 -  
2:11
Amended complaint filed- changing to felony- waive prelim-   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Agreement reached - State moves to dismiss 15cm300,15cm25315cm422 and count 2 in 14cm428 and counts 2-5 in 15cm151
Plea questionnaires filed- No contest plea to count 1 in 15cm151 as now amended, No contest plea to Count 1as charged in 14cm428 and 15cm379 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Michlig/Cirilli- provides def exhibit 1- report from Koinonia/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing - 
15cm151 - Court WHS and POP for 3 years - 30 month-  revocation of DL -driver assessment - IID 1 year -6 months jail - huber for all purposes - Fine of $3000 total to be taken from bond - Court does not give credit for time served but will give credit for time served at Koinonia-       Court will grant release today and to report back to jail within 20 days of todays date and at discretion of PO - to submit to any testing requested by PO - No intoxicants - Defendant to submit DNA sample-   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
14cm428 - Court WHS and POP for 1 year - CC- CC/CV/Supervision fees -Domestic abuse surcharge -  costs from bonds posted
15cm379 - Court WHS and POP For 1 year CC -CC/CV/Supervision fees - Costs from bonds posted 
Conditions of probation -Continue AODA and reocvery as recommended -
Balance of bond if in MR. Gronitz's name to be sent to Gary cirilli
Appeal rights/voting rights given 
Balance of bond , if any to be returned to parties that posted
from PFO to Cirillii regarding treatment

2:36 p.m. Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr 993, 15cm379, 14cm428, 15cm253, 15cm151, 15cm422, 15cm300. Cirillie to represent on all cases -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea - Defendant statement to in patient treatment - Defendant request Court to contact Koinonia to request them to open a bed for him - Court states defendant should talk to Attorney Cirilli - Court will make phone call on defendant's behalf if Stip is filed by parties
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Adj. 2:40 p.m.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Wife needs to get more funds to Attorney Cirilli. Attempted to get into Koinonia - and wife tried facility in Green Bay - both facilities full. Defendant has had no personal discussions with Cirilli.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19,  2015 at 02:30 pm. Bail continued. Adj. 1:36 p.m.

2:53 p.m. Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states has attempted to retain Attorney Cirilli-his wife is working on it. Bail continued. Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No intoxicants; no taverns. May be released to inpatient treatment facility for successful completion of treatment.

1:36 p.m. Defendant Joseph M. Gronitz in court, via video, in custody.   Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint will be provided, right to counsel - defendant states he is represented by Gary Cirilli in underlying case, Schieck statement to bail. Defendant states has been sober for 20 days- going to AA meetings-fell asleep in truck waiting for wife - volunteered to take breathalizer at time of arrest - Court reads police report that states he refused PBT breathalizer. Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
